tn.text: Here David represents his soldiers. AT: "David and his soldiers attacked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "he" refers to David who represents his soldiers. AT: "Then they defeated" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: measured their men with a line ... He measured off two lines to put to death, and one full line to keep alive
tn.text: Here the "line" is a "rope." David had the soldiers lie down on the ground to be measured and sorted into three groups. The men in two groups were killed, and in the third, they were allowed to live.
Here both "David" and "Hadadezer" represent their armies. AT: "David and his army then defeated the army of Hadadezer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
